alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 12:13AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee and northeastern Fayette Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1213 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Muldoon, or 8 miles west of La Grange, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Giddings, La Grange, Round Top, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Carmine, Northrup, Rutersville, Warrenton, Ledbetter, Waldeck, Rabbs Prairie, Plum, Warda, Walhalla, Winedale, West Point, Winchester, Kirtley and Nechanitz. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
